alert.note: Alert for Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 19 at 1:03PM CDT until March 23 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...Arkansas... Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill affecting Webster and Columbia Parishes. For the Bayou Dorcheat...including Springhill, Dixie Inn, Lake Bistineau...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bayou Dorcheat Near Springhill. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Expect minor lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM CDT Sunday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The bayou is expected to rise to a crest of 11.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.8 feet on 03/27/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 115 PM CDT.
